note.p: Birth: Cowes, Isle of Wight, England (10 September 1821)

Career: Commission in the Royal Engineers (1839); went to the Cape of Good Hope (1841); served against the Kaffirs (1846-1847); returned to England (1848); Assistant Inspector General of Fortifications, War Office (1856); Secretary, Royal Commission on the defence of the United Kingdom (1859-1860); Director of Works for fortifications (1862); Governor of the Straits Settlements (1875); Governor of South Australia (1877-1883); Lieutenant General, Royal Engineers; Governor of New Zealand (1883-1889); died after a carriage accident
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1897-1898 vol 62 pp xxxvii-xl signed by C W W
References: Robin J H Clark and Michael J Kelly, 'New Zealand, New Zealanders and the Royal Society' in NR 1994 vol 48 pp 263-281
R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
Notes: F A Abel has signed election certificate twice
